ARABIC: وَلَن يُؤَخِّرَ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهَا وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Allah will not give anyone more time, once their time has come. Allah is aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But God does not grant a soul respite once its term has come to end. And God is aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But when a person's term comes to an end, Allah never grants any respite. Allah is well aware of all that you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God will never grant respite to any soul when its appointed time has come. God is Well-Aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And Allah will never give respite to any soul when its promise arrives; and Allah is Aware of your deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And Allah grants respite to none when his appointed time comes. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And Allah does not respite a soul when its appointed term has come, and Allah is Aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But God will never defer any soul when its term comes. And God is aware of the things you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But Allah reprieveth no soul when its term cometh, and Allah is Informed of what ye do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But God will not grant a reprieve to a soul when its appointed time has come; God is well-aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And Allah deferreth not a soul when its term- hath come; and Allah is Aware of that which ye do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But Allah will never respite anyone when his time has come, and Allah is well aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But to no soul will Allah grant respite when the time appointed (for it) has come; and Allah is well acquainted with (all) that ye do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And Allah grants respite to none when his appointed time (death) comes. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But Allah will never defer any soul when its term comes. Allah is Aware of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But God will not delay a soul when its time has come. God is Informed of what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But never will Allah delay a soul when its time has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [63:11] But God will never reprieve a soul when its term has come. And God is Aware of what you do (ta‘malūna; also read [as the third person plural] ya‘malūna, ‘they do’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But Allah reprieveth no soul when its term comes, and Allah is Aware of what ye do) whether it is good or evil. From His saying (0 ye who believe) up to here was revealed about the hypocrites; as for Allah's saying (then I would give alms and be among the righteous) if it is taken to mean the hypocrites, then it would mean: I will do with my wealth as the believers do and be among those who are true in their faith'. And of the surah in which Mutual disillusion is mentioned which is Meccan/Medinan, and consists of 18 verses, 241 words, and 1,070 letters: Surah 64: Mutual Disillusion (al-Taghabun) And of the surah in which Mutual disillusion is mentioned which is Meccan/Medinan, and consists of 18 verses, 241 words, and 1,070 letters:
